worked as a registrar, at major trauma department of queens medical centre, nottingham
university trust, nhs, uk from october 2017 onwards.
job content and responsibilities:-
1. support the major trauma service
2. attend the trauma calls to support the emergency department
3. immediate lifesaving interventions by participating in and leading trauma calls in resus.
4. interpreting initial investigations quickly including blood gas, x ray and ct results in resus.
5. liaising with other members of the trauma team, from all different specialties and documenting
findings and plans in the major trauma documentation.
6. the management of multi system trauma
7. attend the daily meetings and rounds
8. present new trauma cases from the previous day at the morning meeting
9. have a in depth knowledge of the patients on the service
10. be responsible to the mt consultant for their ongoing care
11. supervises the medical team
12. leads the daily ward round ( acting up as major trauma consultant within the hospital with top
cover)
13. provide ongoing care to level 1 (c30 ward) patients
14. the appropriate use of monitoring in level 1 beds and interpretation of data obtained
15. the provision of safe and effective care including pain relief to patients undergoing all required
surgical procedures.
16. undertake tertiary surveys on all poly trauma admissions
involving team working and leadership, right from the onset of patient care. practicing
orthopedic surgery appeals to me as a humanistic, challenging field, offering the opportunity to
provide immediate help to people in the most vital aspect of their lives: their health. major
opportunities. i want to be an active contributor of this area.

25. in brief: my duties at ed recess included, attendance of major trauma emergency calls,
doing primary surveys, conducting emergency investigations, including arterial blood
gases, full trauma ct etc., stabilization of patients, in co-ordination with ed team,
carrying out emergency procedures such as intercostal tube etc., consulting and
contacting necessary specialists and activating major haemorrhage protocol. i was also
managing ward major trauma patients in the wards, icu and hdu, co-coordinating and
liaising with around 30 different specialties related with major trauma, ed, trauma icu
and hdu staff, rehabilitation team and para medical staff including physiotherapists,
pain team, critical care outreach team etc., teaching medical students and supervising
junior clinical fellows, doing secondary and tertiary surveys in ward and ward
procedures, co-operating with the audits and research programs, attending daily major
trauma and orthopaedic and trauma combined meetings and major trauma board and
presenting and discussing the cases. i was assisting the major trauma consultants during
rounds. my duties also included, ordering investigations and preparing discharge
summaries.

sushrusha hospital, kottayam, india
i successfully managed emergency and trauma as part time orthopaedic surgeon at the outpatient
clinic, emergency room and the inpatients of this hospital. i also did many major surgeries like
plating, bone grafting, austin more hip prosthesis, tumor excision, implant removal, nailing etc.
and minor procedures like knee aspiration, tendon suturing, i&d s, management of deep injuries,
plastering, local steroid infiltrations, strapping and reduction of displaced fractures and
dislocations etc. successfully in addition to the successful treatment of many patients with low
back pain, knee pain, arthritis, infection etc. at outpatient clinic or as in patients in this hospital. i
was also involved in teaching and conducting various seminars and orthopedic state and national
running of the department and i regularly attended consultant and clinical governance meetings.

may 2005 - sep 2008
specialist orthopedic surgery
karipal hospital, kalathipadi, india
the hospital serves as a reference hospital for all different kinds of major orthopedic cases. my
duties included initial reception of orthopedic and trauma patients presenting to emergency,
resuscitate and stabilize them and conduction trauma and orthopedic outpatient clinic. i did many
major surgeries like plating, implant and wire fixations, revision amputations, bone grafting,
tumor excision, hip prosthesis, nailing, exfix, dhs, percutaneous screws etc. and minor
procedures like knee aspiration, tendon suturing, plastering, local steroid infiltrations, strapping
and reduction of displaced fractures and dislocations etc. successfully. i was also involved in
was also involved in managerial and administrative aspects of the running of the department and
i regularly attended consultant and clinical governance meetings.
oct 2003 to feb 2004
specialist orthopedic surgery
kmc, vadavathoor, kottayam, india.
i successfully managed emergency, trauma, surgical and medical patients as part time general
practitioner and orthopaedic surgeon at the outpatient clinic, emergency room and the inpatients
of this hospital. i also did many major surgeries like plating, bone grafting, austin more hip
prosthesis, tumor excision, implant removal, nailing etc. and minor procedures like knee
aspiration, tendon suturing, i&d s, management of deep injuries, plastering, local steroid
infiltrations, strapping and reduction of displaced fractures and dislocations etc. successfully in
addition to the successful treatment of many patients with low back pain, knee pain, arthritis,
infection etc. at outpatient clinic or as in patients in this hospital
aug 2002 oct 2003
teaching staff in medical college and specialist orthopedic surgery
orthopedics department, kottayam, india
the hospital serves as a reference hospital for all different kinds of major medical and surgical
emergencies and orthopedic cases. as a teaching staff i supervised the post graduate students in
managing and stabilizing emergency cases, documentation of medico legal cases, emergency and
routine surgeries and management of patients in outpatient clinics and wards. i did or supervised
many major surgeries especially cold cases like osteomyelitis debridement, spine discectomies,
surgical reduction of chronic dislocations, arthroplasties etc. successfully. i was also involved in
managerial and administrative aspects of the running of the department and the organization of
medical seminars and teaching programs and i regularly attended consultant and clinical
governance meetings. i took general and orthopedic classes to mbbs students as lecturer in
medical college.
sep 2000 - aug 2002
specialist orthopedic surgery
lal memorial hospital, irinjalakkuda, india
this is a modern multispecialty hospital with busy emergency room. i was involved in
conservative or surgical management of trauma and orthopedic cases. during my tenure, i was
including acting as indian medical association branch joint secretary.
feb 2000 sep 2000
junior specialist orthopedic surgery
mbmm hospital, kothamanhalam, india
this is a 400 bedded multispecialty hospital with 24 hour busy emergency room and all modern
amenities. i was working as part of a medical team dealing with emergency and trauma cases and
management of orthopedic patients by conservative and surgical methods including major
surgical procedures and implant surgeries.
mar 1999 - jan 2000
locum specialist of orthopedic surgery
multiple private hospitals in kerala, india
worked as locum specialist of orthopedic surgery, in multiple private hospitals in kerala, india,
and also underwent multiple specialty level exams and their clinical and theoretical preparatory
training.
sep 1998 - feb 1999
working in emergency rooms, outpatient clinics, wards, minor and major operation theatres,
i.c.u., labour camps and as a family doctor of medium or large multi-specialty private hospitals
and clinics and government medical college as a teaching staff. my duties also included initial
reception of patients presenting to emergency, resuscitate and stabilize them. i had been doing
and is experienced and well versed, in all common orthopaedic traumatic and non-traumatic
surgical procedures including plating, exfix, nailing, hemiarthroplasty, tumour surgery,
osteomyelitis etc. i have taken additional training in arthroscopy, arthroplasty, paediatric surgery,
pelvic surgery, hand surgery, plastic surgery and spine surgery and has some experience.
presently i work as a registrar (senior clinical fellow), at major trauma department of queens
medical canter, nottingham university trust, nhs, uk from october 2017 onwards. my duties
at emergency department (recess) included, attendance of major trauma emergency calls at ed,
doing primary surveys, conducting emergency investigations, including arterial blood gases,
teg, radiography, full trauma ct etc., discussing with radiology specialists, stabilization of
patients by applying splints, blood transfusion etc. in co-ordination with ed doctors,
anaesthetists, other specialists, case managers etc., documentation at ed, carrying out emergency
procedures such as intercostal tube, suturing etc., consulting and contacting necessary specialists
such as neurosurgeon, orthopaedic surgeon, plastic surgeon etc., activating major haemorrhage
protocol and organizing ward admission or critical care admission, surgery etc. i was also
managing ward patients in major trauma wards, major trauma patients in trauma icu and hdu,
as per the direction of consultants, co-coordinating and liaising with around 30 different
specialties related with major trauma, major trauma consultants, ed, trauma icu and hdu staff,
rehabilitation team including consultant, physiotherapists and occupational therapists, junior
clinical fellows and para medical staff including pain team, critical care outreach team,
nutritionists, speech therapists, exfix care nurse, pharmacists etc. my duties also included,
teaching medical students and supervising junior clinical fellow i was also doing, secondary and
tertiary surveys in the ward, patient progress review, ward medical and surgical procedures and
co-operating with the audits and research programmes. my duties also included, attendance of
daily major trauma and orthopaedic and trauma combined meetings and major trauma board and
presenting and discussing the cases. i was also attending other meetings, including mortality
morbidity meetings. i was assisting the major trauma consultants during rounds, at major trauma
wards, icu, hdu and out-layers. my duties also included, obtaining patient consents and
discussing with by standers, ordering investigations, writing medications and treatment orders,
retrieving reports, preparing ttos and discharge summaries, through trust web sites and
documentations in different forms and patient case charts.
i worked in qatar as an orthopaedic surgeon in 2016 my duties included management of trauma

supervised 5 nurses clinics and inspected and coordinated the trauma management and safety
officers, training of staff and workers.

1). discussion forum with 2000 medical and ortho links
dr. jimmy created a web site with around 2000 medical and orthopedic links, many patients
information and accident care links, fellowship links, facilities to upload files and photos of
members and facility to see web casts. the site was linked to a discussion forum in msn group
and it had around 800 medical and related experts as members. the site was created in 2003.
the site was created in such a way that just by looking at the home page of site, it was
possible to know: what are the free medical and orthopedic or medical information headings
available in net. the site was also acting as semi-official site for kerala orthopedic association.
the url of the site was www.keralaorthopaedicsinternational.tk. later the group migrated to multiply and the present urls are keralaorthopaedics.multiply.com and keralaorthopaedics
international.org. dr. jimmy acted as manager of kerala orthopedics international web site from
2003 onwards. these web sites contain many accident care links which are useful to general
public.

because of the inspiration obtained by the semi-official site of dr. jimmy m. l. kerala
orthopedic association allowed dr. jimmy m. l. to create a new official web site for kerala
orthopedic association and the url of the site was www.keralaorthopaedicassociation.tk at 2005.
a new post named state i.t.secretary post was created by the association in 2005 & dr. jimmy
acted as i.t.secretary for 5 years. the site was linked to kerala orthopedics international site
with 2000 links, koa discussion site, notification area and clinical research instruments sub
site. the site has many accident care links, official files and photos and seminar reports. the clinical research instruments sub site is useful for research work. the site was later improvised
and the url was changed (2007 to 2010) to keralaorthopaedicassociation.org.
3). web site upgradation in 2011
a new personal web site of dr. jimmy m.l. was created www.doctorjimmy.net (old site was
www.doctorjimmy.tk). the site contains links to face book, articles, seminar reports, consultation
times and other important sites managed by dr. jimmy m. l.

specialist orthopedic surgery
al iqbal hospital, chentrapinny, india.
my duties included initial reception of all patients presenting to emergency, resuscitate and

zurich university hospital, zurich, switzerland.

1998 mar - june 1998
altatatten kanton hospital, alstatten, st. gallen, switzerland
med.thomas herron in altatatten kanton hospital and also under spine surgeons, at st.gallen
kanton hospital, switzerland. i was given training in trauma emergency management and a.o.
principles of fracture fixation. i was able to closely observe european bed side manners and
hospital administration. i obtained training in arthroscopy and arthroplasty surgeries of hip, knee,
shoulder, elbow and ankle. during my tenure, i visited ao international headquarters and
research centre in davos, switzerland and visited w.h.o., red cross and u.n. headquarters in
geneva, switzerland.

little flower mission hospital, angamaly, india
this is a 2000 bedded modern multispecialty and super specialty hospital with 24 hour busy
emergency room and all modern amenities. i was working a part of a medical team dealing with
emergency and trauma cases and management of orthopedic patients by conservative and
surgical methods including major surgical procedures and implant surgeries. i was also
managing inpatients and outpatient clinics and was involved in doing clinical research and
teaching of nursing students.
july 1996 - jul 1997
orthopedic surgery registrar (spr o&t)
kovai medical center, coimbatore, india
worked as p.g. trainee (and registrar), for diploma in orthopedics (dnb-ortho, national
board), at kovai medical centre, coimbatore, india. i was trained in orthopedic trauma,
arthroscopy and arthroplasty surgeries. did review of clinical features and surgical analysis of
120 cases of lumber discectomy , as dissertation. as spr o&t, managed patients in emergency
room and wards and assisted surgical cases in theater. i was involved in scientific meetings,
journal clubs, presentations and training programs. i was also seconded, for one month as
medical officer in i.c.u. with around 20 beds having post traumatic orthopedic and neuro
surgical patients and post-operative patients and also medical patients with stroke, heart attack,
pneumonia, asthma, coma etc. i was managing patients on artificial ventilators, monitoring cvp,
ecg and pulse oximeter and drawing samples for blood gas analysis and endo tracheal tube co2
measurement. i was supervising the weaning of the patients from ventilator support and also
doing procedures like endo tracheal intubation, inter costal tube fixation and starting central
lines. i was managing asthmatic patients, patients with dehydration and electrolyte imbalance,
monitoring myocardial infarction patients on thrombolysis and doing cpr including
defibrillation.

personal statement
after gaining my primary medical degree (mbbs), i was working as residential medical officer
and general practitioner for around 2 years in india. after that, i passed post graduate diploma in
orthopaedics (d-ortho) from india. following that, i completed diploma of national board of
examinations (dnb ortho) course from india and completed the thesis on review of clinical
features and surgical analysis of 120 cases of lumber discectomy . i also completed i.c.u.
training for two months. then i did international fellowship (fasif) in trauma and completed
world orthopaedic programme (woep) from switzerland and a course on ao
principles from germany.
after that, i was working as orthopaedic surgeon in kerala, india. i have 26 years experience
as medical doctor, 22 years experience as orthopaedic surgeon in india, experience of carrying
out almost all different types of orthopaedic procedures and major surgeries, experience of
speakers were vanitha chief editor mrs. prema mammen mathew, district collector,
school principal, writer prof.ambalapuza ramavarma and cinema artist jayakumar.
